intro: Corrigiola andina, commonly known as mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, succulent leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Corrigiola andina is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
